optionalfeature.name: Aura of Despair
entries: You can create an aura of hopelessness around you.

You can cause your Aura of Hate to generate dark, swirling energies. Enemies within your Aura of Hate gain disadvantage on their saving throw rolls. The effect lasts while you concentrate, up to 1 minute.
Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Divine Boon
entries: You consume magical energy to increase your or your ally's chances of a successful attack, save, or check.

When you or an ally within 30 feet that you can see makes an attack, saving throw, or ability check roll but before the outcome is determined, you can use a reaction and expend a spell slot. If you expend a first level spell slot, roll a d4 and add the result to the previous roll. If you expend a second level spell slot, you can roll two d4s. If you expend a third or higher level spell slot, you can roll three d4s.
Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

otherSummary.entry: Cleric, Paladin, or Sorcerer (Divine Soul only)

optionalfeature.name: Fiendish Servant
entries: You can summon and command a fiend.

You can use an action to summon a fiend from the lower planes. The fiend must have a CR equal to or less than one-fourth your Paladin level, rounded down. The fiend is bound to you for the next 24 hours.

A bound creature must follow your instructions to the best of its ability. You might command the creature to accompany you on an adventure, to guard a location, or to deliver a message. The creature obeys the letter of your instructions. If the creature carries out your instructions completely before the spell ends, it travels to you to report this act if you are on the same plane of existence. If you are on a different plane of existence, it returns to the place where you bound it and remains there until the spell ends.
You can only have one fiendish servant at a time. If you summon another fiendish servant while you currently have one already bound, the latter immediately returns to its plane of existence.
Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Improved Aura of Conquest
entries: Your Conquering Presence is more potent than normal.
As Aura of Conquest, except each frightened creature takes extra psychic damage equal to half your Charisma modifier when it starts its turn there.

optionalfeature.name: Improved Aura of the Guardian
entries: Your Aura of the Guardian is more potent than normal.
Whenever you shield an ally from harm through your Aura of the Guardian, you can choose to reduce the damage you take to half.
Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Improved Aura of Treachery
entries: Your Aura of Treachery is more potent than normal.
You gain the following additional benefits:
Cull the Herd. When you hit a creature that has one or more of its allies within 5 feet of it with a melee weapon, you deal extra weapon damage equal to your Charisma modifier.

Treacherous Strike. When you force an attacker to reroll an attack against a creature of your choice that is also within 5 feet of the attacker, you can add your Charisma modifier to the attacker's roll.

optionalfeature.name: Improved Champion's Challenge
entries: You deal extra damage to creatures affected by your Champion's Challenge.
Your weapon attacks against creatures under the effect of your Champion's Challenge deal extra weapon damage equal to your Charisma modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Improved Divine Allegiance
entries: You take less damage when you use your Divine Allegiance.
When you use your reaction to magically substitute your own health for that of the target creature, you can choose to take only half the damage.
You can use this feature for Divine Allegiance three times. You regain all expended uses once you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Improved Guided Strike
entries: Your Guided Strikes hit harder than normal.
When you hit a creature after using Guided Strike, you deal extra damage equal to your Charisma modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Improved Poison Strike
entries: You are more accurate with your attacks when you use Poison Strike.
When you make an attack roll with a poisoned weapon after using Poison Strike, you can add your Charisma modifier to the roll.

optionalfeature.name: Improved Rebuke the Violent
entries: Your Rebuke the Violent is more potent than normal.
As Rebuke the Violent, but the attacker takes extra damage equal to your Charisma modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Swift Lay on Hands
entries: You can use your Lay on Hands feature quicker than normal.
You can take a bonus action to use your Lay on Hands feature.
Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you complete a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Deep Spelunker
entries: Your familiarity with the environs of the Underdark allows you to move through it easily, even in the most difficult conditions.
You have advantage on Strength (Athletics) or Dexterity (Acrobatics) checks when in natural subterranean surroundings.

optionalfeature.name: Greater Planar Warrior
entries: You can deal the extra force damage gained from Planar Warrior damage each time you hit the creature.
You gain advantage on your attacks against a creature you targeted with your Planar Warrior feature this turn. This feature lasts until you hit the creature with an attack.

optionalfeature.name: Hide of Stone
entries: Your body embraces the rigors of the Underdark and can take on something of its hue and toughness. You can turn your skin to look like and feel as cold and hard as the natural stonework in your surroundings.

You can use an action to transform your outer skin into stone that blends well with the surroundings. You gain resistance to nonmagical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage. In addition, you impose disadvantage on creature's Intelligence and Wisdom checks when trying to detect your presence in subterranean surroundings.
This effect lasts while you maintain concentration, up to an hour.
Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Improved Distant Strike
entries: You can teleport farther than normal.
As Distant Strike, except you can teleport up to 20 feet before each attack.

optionalfeature.name: Improved Guardian Aura
entries: Your aura is more potent than normal.
As Guardian Aura, except as follows:
the range of your aura is increased to 40 feet
the aura can affect creatures who have half or more of its hit points

optionalfeature.name: Improved Guardian Soul
entries: Your mobility increases and your bark-like skin becomes harder when in guardian form.
As Guardian Soul, except when in guardian form your speed is increased to 15 feet. In addition, the damage you take from bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing attacks is reduced by 2.

optionalfeature.name: Improved Planar Warrior
entries: You deal extra damage with your Planar Warrior feature.
Prerequisite: Ranger level 6,  Archetype.
As Planar Warrior, except you deal an extra {@damage 1d8} force damage the next time you hit the targeted creature.

optionalfeature.name: Improved Slayer's Prey
entries: You can deal extra damage to a creature you targeted with Slayer's Prey more often than normal.
You deal the extra damage each time you hit the target of your Slayer's Prey feature with a weapon attack instead of just the first time during a turn.

optionalfeature.name: Improved Supernatural Defense
entries: You can anticipate and read the attacks of the target of your Slayer's Eye, helping you avoid them.
You impose disadvantage to your Slayer's Prey's target's first attack roll made against you each turn.

optionalfeature.name: Slay Monster
entries: You can deal a mortal blow to the target of your Slayer's Prey.

On your turn, after successfully hitting a target of your Slayer's Prey with your weapon, you can choose to deal an extra 35 ({@damage 10d6}) damage. The target is allowed a Constitution saving throw equal to 8 + your proficency bonus + your Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice). On a successful save, the target takes only half the extra damage.
Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Tremor Sense
entries: Your connection with the Underdark increases, providing you with enhanced senses.
Prerequisite: Ranger level 9,  archetype.
You gain Tremorsense out to 30 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Bravado
entries: You perform athletic and acrobatic stunts with style.
Prerequisite: Rogue level 6,  Archetype.
You can can add your Charisma modifier to the result of your Strength or Dexterity ability check or saving throw.
Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Combat Mobility
entries: When you move before an attack, you deal more damage.
Whenever you move at least 20 feet, you deal an extra {@damage 1d6} weapon damage on your next weapon attack this turn.

optionalfeature.name: Cunning Maneuver
entries: You can catch your opponent by surprise with an acrobatic stunt.

You can use your Cunning Action to move through a creature's space by using an acrobatic stunt - a tumble, a flip, a pirouette, a slide, or a barrel roll. When you do so, you can make a Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) check contested by the creature's Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) check. If your check succeeds, you can use Sneak Attack against that creature even if you do not have advantage against it or if no enemy of the target is within 5 feet of it. You can use Sneak Attack in this way even if you have disadvantage against the target. However, you are still only allowed one Sneak Attack per turn. If your check fails, you are unable to move into the creature's space, fall prone and stopping within 5 feet of it, fall prone. Your speed also becomes 0 and you gain disadvantage to your attacks until the end of the turn.

optionalfeature.name: Eye for Danger
entries: You can spot danger and threats earlier than others, allowing you to react quicker.
You can can add your Insight proficiency bonus to your saving throws, initiative rolls, or Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks.
Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Killer's Insight
entries: You use your knowledge of a creature to your advantage during combat.
Whenever you deal sneak attack damage against a creature you have observed or interacted with for at least 1 minute, you deal an extra {@damage 1d6} weapon damage.

optionalfeature.name: Hit and Run
entries: You can attack an enemy before you move away from it when you use the feature granted by Skirmisher.
When you use the Skirmisher feature, you can make one weapon attack at the same enemy before or after you move.
Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Improved Insightful Fighting
entries: Your sneak attacks deal more damage than normal when performing Insightful Fightning.
Prerequisite: Rogue level 6,  Archetype.
You can can add your Wisdom modifier to the result of your Sneak Attack damage rolls to creatures targeted by your Insight checks.

optionalfeature.name: Instinctive Tactician
entries: You can help allies even if it is not your turn.
As Master of Tactics, except you can also use a reaction to use the Help action.
Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Rakish Assassin
entries: You execute sneak attacks with rakish charm and debonaire form.
You can add your Charisma modifier to your Sneak Attack damage rolls.

optionalfeature.name: Uncanny Save
entries: Your uncanny reflexes enable you to avoid the brunt of physical and elemental attacks attacks or slip out of of mental assaults and holds.
When you are required to make a saving throw other than a Dexterity saving throw, you can choose to use your Dexterity saving throw instead.
Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Baleful Curse of the Sea
entries: You can trigger a more potent curse effect.
As Curse of the Sea, except there is an additional effect if the target fails its saving throw against the spell. If the spell doesn't have a saving throw, apply the additional effect.
Cold Damage. The target is slowed for 1 minute. The target is allowed a Constitution saving throw equal to your Sorcerer spell save DC at the end of each of its turns to end the effect.
Lightning Damage. The target is paralyzed until the end of your next turn.
Forced Movement. The target is knocked prone.
Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Blessed by the Gods
entries: You can make Favored of the Gods more effective than normal.
When you use Favored of the Gods, you can choose to add your Charisma modifier to the result.
Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest. You can still use Favored of the Gods normally.

optionalfeature.name: Burst of Divine Energy
entries: You can create a nimbus of energy that can heal allies and hurt enemies.

While using Otherworldly Wings, you can use an action and choose a number of creatures within 30 feet that you can see equal to your Charisma modifier. Roll {@dice 4d8}. The creatures you chose regain hit points equal to the number you rolled. All other creatures take damage equal to the number you rolled. The damage type is radiant if you are good or lawful and necrotic if you are evil or chaotic. You can choose either if you are neutral. Creatures are allowed a Charisma saving throw equal to your Sorcerer spell save DC. On a failed save, they take only half the damage.
Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Burst of Exalted Glory
entries: You can create a sphere of energy that protects your allies and blinds your enemies.

While using Otherworldly Wings, choose a number of creatures within 30 feet that you can see equal to your Charisma modifier as a reaction. Until the end of start of your next turn, you and the chosen creatures gain resistance to all damage and advantage to all saving throws.
All other creatures within 30 feet must make a Charisma saving throw equal to your Sorcerer spell save DC. On a failed save, they are blinded until the end of your next turn.
Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Divine Boon
entries: You consume magical energy to increase your or your ally's chances of a successful attack, save, or check.
Prerequisite: Cleric, Paladin, or Sorcerer (Divine Soul only).

When you or an ally within 30 feet that you can see makes an attack, saving throw, or ability check roll but before the outcome is determined, you can use a reaction and expend a spell slot. If you expend a first level spell slot, roll {@dice 1d4} and add the result to the previous roll. If you expend a second level spell slot, you can roll {@dice 2d4}. If you expend a third or higher level spell slot, you can roll {@dice 3d4}.
Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

otherSummary.entry: Cleric, Paladin, or Sorcerer (Divine Soul only)

optionalfeature.name: Extra Mantle of Flame
entries: You can invoke Mantle of Flame more often than normal.
You can use Mantle of Flame one additional time between long rests.
When you use this feature a second time before a long rest, you suffer one level of exhaustion (as described in appendix A of the PHB).

optionalfeature.name: Forked Lightning
entries: You can strike up to three creatures with powerful lightning strokes.

As an action on your turn, choose up to three creatures within 60 feet of you that you can see. The creatures must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them. Lightning springs forth from your hand and splits, arcing toward your chosen targets. Each creature must must make a Dexterity saving throw equal to your Sorcerer spell save DC. A creature takes 45 ({@damage 10d8}) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success. This feature is considered as a spell for Heart of the Storm's purposes.
Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Greater Form of the Phoenix
entries: You can take the form of a fiery phoenix.
As Form of the Phoenix and Mantle of the Flame, except you can choose to take the true form the Phoenix:
You have a flying speed of 80 feet.

You gain the physical stats, hit points, Hit Dice, and qualities of a Fire Elemental except you take the shape and form of a giant fiery eagle and you retain your Intelligence, Wisdom, Charisma scores, skill and saving throw proficiencies, in addition to gaining those of a Fire Elemental. For all other details, this feature follows the rules and restrictions provided by the Polymorph spell

optionalfeature.name: Improved Hound of Ill Omen
entries: Your Hound of Ill Omen is more resilient than normal.
As Hound of Ill Omen, but in addition the Hound also has resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks.

optionalfeature.name: Improved Tempestuous Magic
entries: You can manuever more freely with Tempestuous Magic than normal.
As Tempestuous Magic, except you can fly in any direction, up to a distance of 15 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Manipulate Earth
entries: You can control and manipulate the earth, stone, and metal around you, using it as a weapon or a means to move.
While using Stone's Durability, you can enter into a state where you can mentally manipulate the earth around you. Each turn, you can perform the following abilities:

Launch Earth. As an action, you remove and raise a 5-foot square section of the earth from the ground and launch it to a target within 60 feet of you. Each creature in a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a Dexterity saving throw. The save DC is equal to your Sorcerer spell save DC. A target creature takes {@damage 3d6} bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Raise or Lower Earth. As a bonus action, you can raise or lower the 5-foot square section of a ground within 30 feet. You can raise or lower the earth to a height or depth of up to 20 feet, creating a pillar of earth or a pit. You can continue to raise the pillar or lower the pit's depth, up to 20 feet per bonus action, up to a total of 60 feet.

Form Bridge. As a bonus action, you can create a bridge made from earth 20 feet long and 5 feet wide. You can continue to lengthen the bridge, up to 20 feet per bonus action, up to a total of 60 feet. However, the origin point of the bridge must stay connected to the earth at all times. Otherwise, the bridge collapses.
This feature lasts while you maintain concentration, up to 1 minute. Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Sea Form
entries: You can transform into a Water Elemental.

You can take a bonus action to transform into a Water Elemental. For all other details, this feature follows the rules and restrictions provided by the Polymorph spell except that you retain the ability to cast spells while in this form and the effect lasts while you concentrate, up to a number of turns equal to your Charisma modifier.
Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Stone Form
entries: You can transform into an Earth Elemental.

You can take a bonus action to transform into an Earth Elemental. For all other details, this feature follows the rules and restrictions provided by the Polymorph spell except that you retain the ability to cast spells while in this form and the effect lasts while you concentrate, up to a number of turns equal to your Charisma modifier.
Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Stone's Protection
entries: You can temporarily harden the density of your stone armor.

While using Stone's Durability to gain a bonus to your AC while not wearing armor and you are hit by an attack that deals bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage, you can use a reaction and gain resistance to that attack's damage.
Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you complete a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Storm Form
entries: You can transform into an Air Elemental.

You can take a bonus action to transform into an Air Elemental. For all other details, this feature follows the rules and restrictions provided by the Polymorph spell except that you retain the ability to cast spells while in this form and the effect lasts while you concentrate, up to a number of turns equal to your Charisma modifier.
Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Summon Shadow
entries: You can summon Shadows from the Shadowfell that obey your command.
As a bonus action you can spend up to 6 Sorcery points and summon a Shadow for every 2 Sorcery points you spent.

The Shadows are friendly to you and your companions. Roll initiative for the summoned creatures as a group, which has its own turns. They obey any verbal commands that you issue to them (no action required by you). If you don't issue any commands to them, they defend themselves from hostile creatures, but otherwise take no actions.
The Shadows last while you concentrate, up to an hour.

optionalfeature.name: Water Jet
entries: You can blast creatures with powerful sea water.

As an action on your turn, you can magically shoot water in a 60-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a Dexterity saving throw. The DC is equal to your Sorcerer spell save DC. On a failure, a target takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) bludgeoning damage and, if it is Huge or smaller, is pushed up to 20 feet away from you and knocked prone. On a success, a target takes half the bludgeoning damage, but is neither pushed nor knocked prone.
Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Wraith Form
entries: You can transform yourself into a wraith-like creature.
You can spend 10 sorcery points to transform youself into a creature similar to a wraith. It has identical features described in Shadow Form, except in addition, you gain the following benefits:
You have a flying speed of 60 feet.

On your turn, you can use an action to make a melee spell attack that deals 21 ({@damage 4d8+3}) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw equal to your Sorcerer spell save DC or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

optionalfeature.name: Aurora Wave
entries: You can create a blast wave of radiant energy when you invoke Shielding Aura.

When you use Shielding Aura, you create a brilliant explosion of energy centered on you. All creatures within 10 feet of you must make a Dexterity saving throw against your Warlock spell save DC. Creature takes {@damage 3d8} radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

optionalfeature.name: Dragged From Hell
entries: Your Hurl Through Hell feature can also drag a fiend from hell.

As Hurl Through Hell, except in addition you also summon a random fiend that has a CR equal to or less than one third your Warlock level. This fiend continues to attack the target of your Hurl Through Hell and its allies for a number of rounds equal to your Charisma Modifier, after which it returns back to its plane.

optionalfeature.name: Extra Queen's Right Hand
entries: You can use Queen's Right Hand more often than normal, but it taxes you.
You can use Queen's Right's Hand one additional time between long rests.
When you use this feature a second time before a long rest, you suffer one level of exhaustion (as described in appendix A of the PHB).

optionalfeature.name: Extra Shielding Aura
entries: You can use Shielding Aura more often than normal.
You can use Shielding Aura one additional time between rests.

optionalfeature.name: Greater Hexblade's Curse
entries: Your Hexblade's Curse is more potent than normal.
As Hexblade's Curse, except the target gains vulnerability to your attacks.

optionalfeature.name: Hexblade's Mettle
entries: Your nature makes you resistant to magical attacks.
You can reroll any saving throw against spells.
Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Improved Celestial Resilience
entries: Your Celestial Resilience is more potent than normal.

As Celestial Resilience, except that you and the creatures you chose also gain resistance to radiant and fire damage. They also gain a bonus to all their saving throws equal to your Charisma modifier. These benefits last for an hour.

optionalfeature.name: Improved Dark Delirium
entries: Your Dark Delirium is more potent than normal.
As Dark Delirium, except you impose disadvantage to the target's saving throw roll.

optionalfeature.name: Improved Healing Light
entries: Your Healing Light is more potent than normal.
You add your Charisma modifier to the amount healed each time you use Healing Light.

optionalfeature.name: Improved Hexblade's Curse
entries: You can bestow an additional debilitating effect on the target of your Hexblade's Curse.

When you use Hexblade's Curse, you can choose to have the target make a Wisdom saving throw. The save DC equals your Warlock spell save DC. On a failed save, choose one ability score. While cursed, the target has disadvantage on ability checks and saving throws made with that ability score.
Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Improved Radiant Soul
entries: Your Radiant Soul is more potent than normal.
Prerequisite: Warlock level 9, the Celestial Patron.
As Radiant Soul, but in addition you can add your Charisma modifier to the damage dealt to all targets of your spells that deals radiant or fire damage.

optionalfeature.name: Instinctive Astral Refuge
entries: You can use Astral Refuge even if it is not your turn.

You can use a reaction to activate Astral Refuge. You immediately take the two actions to cast spells that target only you, and you return to the space you occupied at the end of the current turn. If you used this feature when you were targeted by an attack or was hit by an attack but before the outcome was determined, that attack automatically misses or fails.
Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Knowledge of the Immortal
entries: You have more knowledge of the arcane arts than normal.

Without the need for sleep and basic sustenance has given you more time to devote yourself to the arcane arts. As a result, the number of your known cantrips, spells, and invocations is each increased by 1. In addition, the number of your spell slots is increased by 1.

optionalfeature.name: Raven Strike
entries: You can send your Sentinel Raven to strike to unerringly strike at a target.

As a bonus action during your turn, choose a creature within 100 feet of you that you can see (even through your raven's eyes). Your raven immediately flies and dives toward the target creature. Make a melee spell atack against that creature. On a successful hit, the raven deals {@damage 1d8} piercing damage + your Charisma modifier and the creature gains disadvantage to its next attack until the end of its next turn. The raven's attack is considered a magical weapon attack.
Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Tentacles of the Old One
entries: You can create large grotesque tentacles that grasp and constrict victims.

As a bonus action, you summon several large, alien-like spiny tentacles that fill a 30 foot square on the ground that you can see within range. For the duration, these tentacles turn the ground in the area into difficult terrain.

When a creature enters the affected area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, the creature must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 4d6} bludgeoning damage and be restrained by the tentacles until the effect ends. A creature that starts its turn in the area and is already restrained by the tentacles takes {@damage 4d6} bludgeoning damage.
A creature restrained by the tentacles can use its action to make a Strength or Dexterity check (its choice) against your Warlock spell save DC. On a success, it frees itself.
The effect lasts while you concentrate, up to 1 minute.
Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Undying Fortitude
entries: You are hardier than normal.
You have advantage on death saving throws and saving throws against death attacks and poison.

optionalfeature.name: Undying Resistance
entries: You are resistant to necrotic and poisonous attacks.
You gain resistance to necrotic and poison damage.
In addition, attacks that reduce your Constitution, Strength, or maximum hit points only do half of its effect.

optionalfeature.name: Unleash the Ravens
entries: You can summon a swarm of ravens.
Prerequisite: Warlock level 9, the Raven Queen.

On your turn, you can use an action and summon swarms of fey ravens. You can summon a number of swarms equal to one third your level, rounded down. Each swarm has a bonus to their attack and damage rolls equal to your Charisma modifier.

The summoned swarms are friendly to you and your companions. Roll initiative for the summoned creatures as a group, which has its own turns. They obey any verbal commands that you issue to them (no action required by you). If you don't issue any commands to them, they defend themselves from hostile creatures, but otherwise take no actions. The swarms lasts while you concentrate, up to an hour.
Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Bladesurge
entries: You channel your magic through your weapon for a devastating attack.

While your Bladesong is active and you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can expend one spell slot to deal force damage to the target, in addition to the weapon's damage. The creature takes an extra {@damage 2d6} force damage per spell slot level used (up to a maximum of 12d6). The creature is allowed a Constitution saving throw against your Wizard spell save DC. On a successful save, the creature takes half the force damage.

optionalfeature.name: Extra Channel Arcana
entries: You can use Channel Arcana more often than normal.
You gain one additional use of Channel Arcana between rests.

optionalfeature.name: Forethought
entries: You glimpse visions of immediate danger, enabling you to anticipate and react quicker.
Prerequisite: Wizard level 15,  Arcane Tradition.
You have advantage on all Initiative rolls and Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks and gain a bonus to your passive Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks equal to your Intelligence modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Greater Arcane Ward
entries: Your Arcane Ward is more potent than normal.
You gain +2 AC while protected by Arcane Ward. Additionally, you or the target of your Arcane Ward no longer take the remaining damage if your Arcane Ward's hit points is reduced to 0.

optionalfeature.name: Improved Arcane Deflection
entries: Your Arcane Deflection does not prevent you from casting lower level spells.
When you use Arcane Deflection, you can't cast spells other than cantrips or spells of 2nd level or below until the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Improved Deflecting Shroud
entries: Your Deflecting Shroud is more potent than normal.
Your Deflecting Shroud deals an extra force damage equal to your Intelligence modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Improve Divine Arcana
entries: Your Divine Arcana is more potent than normal.
As Divine Arcana, except the next spell you cast gains a +4 bonus to any attack roll you make for it or to its saving throw DC, as appropriate.

optionalfeature.name: Improved Illusory Self
entries: Your Illusory Self creates more duplicates than normal.

When you use Illusory Self, you create an extra {@dice 1d4} illusory duplicates of yourself. Each image will interpose itself against an attack, causing it to automatically miss, and then it disappears.

optionalfeature.name: Improved Transmuter's Stone
entries: Your Transmuter's Stone has two additional effects.
When you create your Transmuter's Stone, you can choose two benefits instead of just one.
In addition, you can use the benefits of Master Transmuter twice before it consumes the stone.

optionalfeature.name: Lich Touch
entries: You can paralyze a creature with a touch, just like a lich.

You can make a melee spell attack that deals {@damage 3d6} cold damage. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be Paralyzed for 1 minute. The save DC equals your Wizard spell save DC. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Mass Enchantment
entries: You can target more creatures with your single target enchantment spells.

This replaces and does not stack with Split Enchantment. When you cast an enchantment spell of 1st level or higher that targets only one creature, you can have it target an additional two other creatures.

optionalfeature.name: Penetrating Evocation
entries: Once in a while you can cast an Evocation spell that is difficult to resist.
When you cast an Evocation spell, you can impose disadvantage to the saving throws of all its targets.
Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Spellblade
entries: You can channel a melee spell attack through your weapon attack.

While your Bladesong is active and you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can take a bonus action and immediately cast a spell that must target the creature you hit. The spell you cast must require a melee or ranged spell attack and must only take one action to cast.
You can only use this feature once during each Bladesong.

optionalfeature.name: Swift Conjuration Spell
entries: You can sometimes cast certain conjuration spells without effort.
You can take a bonus action to cast a cantrip or a 4th level spell or below from the school of Conjuration.
Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a short or long rest.
